patterns: Do you have any tips on how I can protect myself?
responses: I have some tips for you: 1. You can use a VPN, , 2. Limit apps that have access to your location data, 3. use anti-tracking software, 4. Limit ad tracking, 5. Check if you're sharing your real-time location, 6 Secure your Google account.

patterns: Can you explain what a VPN is?
Can you explain what a VPN is?
responses: A virtual private network (VPN) establishes a secure, encrypted connection between your computer and the internet, providing a private tunnel for your data and communications while you use public networks. A VPN prevents trackers from getting your location data. NOTE: A VPN DOESN't protect you from: malware, phishing scams and data on your device

patterns: Can you explain what anti-tracking software is?
responses: Anti-tracking extensions can detect these trackers and their sources. They can then block them by preventing the source from loading content. Without being able to load its content, the source can't track you.

patterns: Can you explain what ad tracking is?
responses: Ad tracking happens when companies use cookies and other tracking methods to follow you online and gather insights into your behavior and preferences to serve you more relevant, targeted ads.

patterns: How do I secure my google account?
Can you explain how I can secure my google account?
responses: Go to the 'Location History' section of your Google Account. Choose whether your account or your devices can report Location History to Google. Your account and all devices: At the top, turn Location History on or off. Only a certain device: Under 'This device' or 'Devices on this account', turn the device on or off.

patterns: How do I change my location stettings?
I want to change my settings
responses: This is how you change your location settings on the iPhone: Go to Settings > Privacy, then select Location Services. Select an app, then turn Precise Location on or off. And on Android: Open the App Drawer, go into Settings, select Location, and then enter Google Location Settings. Here, you can turn off Location Reporting and Location History.

How do I stop ad tracking?
responses: On Android, go to Settings, and head to ‘Google’. Tap on the ‘Ads’ option, and tap on ‘Reset advertising ID‘. Subsequently, tap on ‘Opt out of ads personalisation‘ to block ad tracking by Google. On iPhone, go to Privacy, and select ‘Apple advertising’. Click on ‘Personalised ads‘. Turn this setting off.
